verses.roman:
brahmāstrasya ca brahmāstraṁ
vāyavyasya ca pārvatam
āgneyasya ca pārjanyaṁ
naijaṁ pāśupatasya ca

synonyms: brahma-astrasya—of the brahmāstra; brahma-astram—a brahmāstra; ca—and; parvatam—a mountain weapon; āgneyasya—of the fire weapon; ca—and; pārjanyam—a rain weapon; naijam—His own weapon (the nārāyaṇāstra); pāśupatasya—of Lord Śiva's own pāśupatāstra
translation: Lord Kṛṣṇa counteracted a brahmāstra with another brahmāstra, a wind weapon with a mountain weapon, a fire weapon with a rain weapon, and Lord Śiva's personal pāśupatāstra weapon with His own personal weapon, the nārāyaṇāstra.
